intro: Alcea leiocarpa, commonly known as the white hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a soft, fuzzy texture. Alcea leiocarpa is often grown for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in well-drained soil with full sun.
